labels.analysis: The Ordiscan MCP Server is primarily focused on providing real-time blockchain data and tools for interacting with Bitcoin's Ordinals ecosystem. Its tools enable users to query and analyze various aspects of Bitcoin inscriptions, BRC-20 tokens, runes, rare sats, and transactions. The server facilitates authenticated queries, making it valuable for users who need to track blockchain assets, monitor market activity, or perform research on Bitcoin's programmable features.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Cryptocurrency & Blockchain" was chosen because the server's core functionality revolves around Bitcoin blockchain queries and interactions with Ordinals-related assets, which are all part of the cryptocurrency ecosystem. The secondary label "Data Analysis & Processing" was added because the tools enable detailed analysis of blockchain data, transactions, and assets. The server's functionality doesn't fit into any predefined categories beyond these, as its focus on Ordinals makes it somewhat unique in the blockchain space.

tools.name: ordiscan_address_brc20_activity
tools.description: Get all BRC-20 token transaction activity for a Bitcoin address

page.description: Page number for pagination (20 transfers per page)

apiKey.description: Your Ordiscan API key. If not provided, will use environment variable ORDISCAN_API_KEY

server_info_crawled.name: Ordiscan MCP Server
server_info_crawled.author: @Calel33/ordiscan-mcp-v1
server_info_crawled.overview: Access real-time blockchain data with a set of 29 tools integrated with the Ordiscan API. Perform authenticated queries on Bitcoin addresses, inscriptions, transactions, collections, runes, BRC-20 tokens, and sats.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

config = {
  "port": 1337,
  "endpoint": "/mcp",
  "responseMode": "stream"
}
# Encode config in base64
config_b64 = base64.b64encode(json.dumps(config).encode()).decode()
smithery_api_key = ""

# Create server URL
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@Calel33/ordiscan-mcp-v1/mcp?config={config_b64}&api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
